results.title: Busy hands
results.creator_credit: A Bhaskarrao, M. Bhavnani and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description: This film shows villagers as they attend cottage industries classes held in their communities in which families learn weaving, rope making, tailoring, tanning and leather work, pottery and other useful trades. NB: Print unable to be screened due to shrinkage.

results.title: Busy bodies
results.brief_description: Discusses how exercise and movement contribute to good health and physical condition. Shows characteristic movement of a variety of animals, followed by children imitating those movements. Narrated by Vic Perrin. Suitable for primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Bustin
results.brief_description: Internet comedy and meme-generator extraordinaire Neil Cicierega (Potter Puppet Pals) creates a video / audio remix of Ray Parker Jnr’s classic film theme that isn’t soon forgotten.

constellations_other.name: Dragon's Lair
constellations_other.description: A look at pop-cultural interconnections that spawn from the lair of Don Bluth's arcade classic.

results.title: Buster Keaton rides again
results.creator_credit: John Spotton, Julian Biggs and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: In this film Buster Keaton rides across Canada on a railway scooter and, between times, rests in a specially appointed passenger coach where he and Mrs Keaton lived during their Canadian film assignment. This film is about how Buster Keaton made a Canadian travel film, “The Railrodder”. In this informal study the comedian regales the film crew with anecdotes of a lifetime in show business. Excerpts from his silent slapstick films are shown. Awards: Seven, including Venice; New York; Melbourne; Milan. Commentary by Donald Brittain.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Spotton, Julian Biggs and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Buster Keaton : a hard act to follow
results.brief_description: Buster Keaton is now regarded as one of the supreme comedians of the silent American cinema. He was also an inventive and dedicated film-maker who performed all of his own stunts yet took little interest in business arrangements. This is a comprehensive survey of Buster Keaton’s life and work including generous extracts from all his feature films and most of his two-reelers. Narrated by Lindsay Anderson. Ep. 1. (53 min.)—Ep. 2. (54 min.)—Ep. 3. (53 min.) Further reference: http://www.busterkeaton.com
results.title_for_label: Buster Keaton : a hard act to follow

results.title: Business: what's it all about?
results.brief_description: This film presents the operations of four different companies relating to basic business functions, problems, skills needed and the importance of business in everyday life. Shows that certain concepts are common to any business such as profit, the distinction between products and services, research and development, production and manufacturing marketing and distribution. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Business activity statement : your one report
results.brief_description: This video provides information about the new Business Activity Statement (BAS), introduced with the Goods and Services Tax. It includes examples showing how to complete a BAS. Presented by Michael Caton.
